anime.description: http://anidb.net/ch92284 [Light] and http://anidb.net/ch92283 [Yomi] are spending their daily lives happily playing video games. One night when everyone else is asleep, Light receives an invitation from http://anidb.net/ch92281 [Alpha], a messenger for someone named King. Light and Yomi are then sucked into another world, where they must undertake a quest to rescue Princess http://anidb.net/ch92282 [Melody] from the demon lord. Light thinks this must be his destiny, while Yomi thinks it`s kind of annoying. They form a party with Alpha to start their quest. Alpha as it turns out is an AI robot, and he has a program that allows them to raise their levels while slowly continuing their adventure. Source: ANN

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: parody
tag.description: Anime that imitate other stories (can be from TV, film, books, historical events, ...) for comic effect by exaggerating the style and changing the content of the original. Also known as spoofs. It can also refer to when whole elements of one work are lifted out of their context and reused.

tag.name: new
tag.description: Not based on anything, the story is a new work, usually made up by the people involved in creating the anime. Generally if an original work (原作) credit is given, it will be to the studio, or director, or other members of the production team.

tag.name: adventure
tag.description: Adventures are exciting stories, with new experiences or exotic locales. Adventures are designed to provide an action-filled, energetic experience for the viewer. Rather than the predominant emphasis on violence and fighting that is found in pure action anime, however, the viewer of adventures can live vicariously through the travels, conquests, explorations, creation of empires, struggles and situations that confront the main characters, actual historical figures or protagonists. Under the category of adventures, we can include traditional swashbucklers, serialized films, and historical spectacles, searches or expeditions for lost continents, "jungle" and "desert" epics, treasure hunts and quests, disaster films, and heroic journeys or searches for the unknown. Adventure films are often, but not always, set in an historical period, and may include adapted stories of historical or literary adventure heroes, kings, battles, rebellion, or piracy.

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: CGI
tag.description: Computer-generated imagery (CGI) or computer animation is the art of creating moving images via the use of computers. It is a subfield of computer graphics and animation. Increasingly it is created by means of 3D computer graphics, though 2D computer graphics are still widely used for stylistic, low bandwidth, and faster real-time rendering needs. Sometimes the target of the animation is the computer itself, but sometimes the target is another medium, such as film.

tag.name: short episodes
tag.description: Short episodes are regular episodes that are much shorter than the standard length. This means up to and including 10 minutes; shows with episodes that are 11 to 20 minutes in length are http://anidb.net/t6494 [half-length episodes] instead. Not to be confused with http://anidb.net/t6349 [multi-segment episodes], which are regular episodes that are split into several short segments (parts), usually with separate titles and independent storylines.

tag.name: 3D CG animation
tag.description: Abbreviation for "three-dimensional computer generated animation" or "computer graphics" (CGI). The traditional 2D art is enhanced by 3D imagery developed through computer modeling software. Done in the right way, this union of 3D in a 2D animated world can be a very beautiful relationship. The difference lies in what lacks the traditional 2D animation all together and may give term to something produced entirely with 3D graphics (such as the 2006 remake of "Appleseed" , 2007`s "Vexille", the 2008 addition to the "Biohazard" series and the more well known "Final Fantasy: The Spirits Within" and "Advent Children").

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: isekai
tag.description:
An isekai story is one in which the lead characters are transferred to and become stuck or trapped in another world, one completely different from the one they lived in up until the transfer. The new world is commonly a http://anidb.net/t2628 [fictional world], such as a http://anidb.net/t2838 [parallel world] or http://anidb.net/t2839 [virtual world] (other fictional world types can also apply). What defines the isekai genre is that the characters are sent to another world, often but not always a parallel one, and they generally cannot come back permanently without meeting a highly specific goal. In order to adapt to their new environment, they must use the abilities and knowledge brought from their former world as well as any that may have been bestowed upon them by their brave new world. In some cases, they will seek and eventually find a way to return; in others, they will gleefully embrace their new life. http://anidb.net/a144 [Inuyasha] is an example where isekai applies to a fictional world that is not also a parallel or virtual world. http://anidb.net/ch7246 [Higurashi Kagome] climbs down an ancient well at her grandfather`s shrine and is transported to feudal Japan (time travel). While she eventually gains the physical ability to travel back and forth between her time period and feudal Japan, her bonds and responsibilities to feudal Japan tie her there until they are ultimately resolved. For clarity, below is an illustrative example where isekai is applied to a non-fictional, non-parallel, non-virtual world.
* The main characters are from Earth. One day, they are abducted by Nazis from Mars (alternate "world") are brought back to their Martian base. The main characters are trapped on Mars. Their only escape is to defeat the Nazis and steal their spaceship to return to Earth (specific goal required to escape); they are left to thier own devices, with no prospect of help from Earth, and no way to contact Earth.

episode.title: 待ってろ! ホーリージャム! (前編)
Wait for Us! Holy Jam! (Part 1)
Mattero! Holy Jam! (Zenpen)
episode.summary: The party is on the hunt for holy gems that will let them upgrade their weapons, but are menaced by deadly traps! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ジョブ診断の館
The Job Assignment Chamber
Job Shindan no Kan
episode.summary: The boys have their job assignments assessed to ensure that they`re well-suited to their roles in the princess`s rescue. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 姫ってどんな子!?
What`s the Princess Like!?
Himette Donna Ko!?
episode.summary: Light, Yomi, and Alfa fantasize about what the princess might be like when they rescue her, while the princess fantasizes about having something in her cell worthy of posting on social media. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ゲーム世界に転生!?
Reborn in a Game World!?
Game Sekai ni Tensei!?
episode.summary: A pair of middle-schoolers are brought into a fantasy world where, with the help of a cyborg butler, they must rescue a princess from the dark lord... if they can stop blabbering on about random subjects long enough to get anywhere. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: "コウリャクボーン"を手に入れた
In Pursuit of the "Straht`ehgee Gyde"
"Kouryaku Bone" o Te ni Ireta
episode.summary: With Alfa broken down, it`s up to Light and Yomi to find a way to get their friend back on his feet. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 惨戦! イケメンオーディション
Competition! The Hottie Audition
Sensen! Ikemen Audition
episode.summary: The party gets roped into a bit of a side-quest when Alfa tries to capitalize on Yomi and Light`s youthful charms to score some cash. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 武器進化!? ファンタジーソード
Weapon Evolution!? Fantasy Sword
Buki Shinka!? Fantasy Sword
episode.summary: After obtaining the Holy Gem, Light`s sword is powered up with... unexpected consequences. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 待ってろ! ホーリージャム! (後編)
Wait for Us! Holy Jam! (Part 2)
Mattero! Holy Jam! (Kouhen)
episode.summary: The boys have to overcome a variety of challenges in order to obtain the Holy Gem. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: また逢う日まで
Until We Meet Again
Mata Au Hi made
episode.summary: Everything seems to have ended well and Light and Yomi start to head home, but then they hear that something terrible might happen to Alfa... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 超かなり目前, マオーの城
The Demon Lord`s Castle Is Like, Right There
Chou Kanari Mokuzen, Maou no Shiro
episode.summary: The boys finally get to the Demon Lord’s castle. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 超目前, マオーの城
The Pre-Eminent Moment: The Dark Lord`s Castle
Chou Mokuzen, Maou no Shiro
episode.summary: Light, Yomi, and Alfa finally arrived at the Demon Lord`s castle. Now they just have to work up the guts to actually go inside. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ドリームアイランドへようこそ!
Welcome to Dream Island!
Dream Island e Youkoso!
episode.summary: The boys see an opportunity to make a lot of money in a theme park, so the quest to rescue the princess is put on temporary hold. Source: crunchyroll
